case_vignette:
A 13-year-old Hispanic boy is brought to the physician by his mother because of left groin pain for 1 month. The pain radiates to his left knee and is aggravated on walking. He fell during soccer practice 5 weeks ago but did not see a doctor about it and does not recall any immediate and persistent pain after the event. He has hypothyroidism. His only medication is levothyroxine. His immunizations are up-to-date. He appears uncomfortable. He is at the 50th percentile for height and at the 95th percentile for weight. His temperature is 37.1°C (98.9°F), pulse is 77/min, respirations are 14/min, and blood pressure is 100/70 mm Hg. The patient has a left-sided, antalgic gait. The left lower extremity is externally rotated. The left hip is tender to palpation and internal rotation is limited by pain. Laboratory studies show:
Hemoglobin 13.1 g/dL
Leukocyte count 9,100/mm3
Platelet count 250,000/mm3
Serum
TSH 3.6 μU/mL
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having left groin pain for the past month, and it hurts more when I walk and also spreads down to my left knee.

Is this pain present at birth or appeared after? (For neonatal diagnosis)

If not, what is your age? (For pediatric diagnosis)
The pain started a month ago, and I am 13 years old.

Does the pain worsen with prolonged sitting or lying down?

**Final Diagnosis:** Osteochondritis Dissecans (of the hip)
